document_data.name: Summon Undead V
document_data.mainbody: '''''Summon undead V''''', also known as '''''undead summoning V''''', was the most powerful of the series of ''[[summon undead]]'' spells available to arcane casters in the [[Forgotten Realms|Realms]].
document_data.Effects:
This spell could summon a [[mummy]], a [[shadow]], a [[vampire spawn]] or a [[wight]]. As an alternative, the spell could summon one to three [[allip]]s or [[ghast]]s, two to five [[ghouls]], two to five huge, large, or medium-sized [[skeleton]]s, or two to five large, medium-sized, or small [[zombie]]s—provided they were all within 30 feet of each other. 

If ghasts, ghouls, or shadows were summoned, the spell was considered a [[:Category:Chaotic spells|chaotic spell]] in addition to an [[:Category:Evil spells|evil]] one. If a mummy or wight was summoned, it was a [[:Category:Lawful spells|lawful spell]].
document_data.Casting: In addition to [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s, this spell required a [[material component]], a piece of bone from either a [[lich]], [[mummy]] or [[vampire]].
document_data.History: This spell was known to be used by wizards of the [[Cult of the Dragon]].
